Questions.Question: Who said, 'You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great'?
Questions.Explanation: Zig Ziglar, a renowned motivational speaker and author, emphasized the importance of taking the first step toward achieving greatness.

Questions.Question: Which leader stated, 'The only way to do great work is to love what you do'?
Questions.Explanation: Steve Jobs, co-founder of Apple Inc., believed that passion for one's work is the key to achieving significant accomplishments.

Questions.Question: Who expressed, 'The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams'?
Questions.Explanation: Eleanor Roosevelt, a prominent First Lady and activist, emphasized the significance of belief and vision in shaping the future.

Questions.Question: Which influential figure claimed, 'Integrity is doing the right thing, even when no one is watching'?
Questions.Explanation: C. S. Lewis, the celebrated author and theologian, highlighted the importance of moral character and ethical conduct.

Questions.Question: Who declared, 'Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much'?
Questions.Explanation: Helen Keller, a symbol of resilience and determination, underscored the power of collaboration and unity in achieving remarkable accomplishments.
